sentences: Nagu alati, mindi ka t채na 체heskoos koju.
Ta tasus oma v천lad alati 천igeaegselt.
See on ikka ja alati nii olnud.
context: The Estonian word 'alati' is an adverb that means 'always'. It can indicate something happening every time, constantly throughout all time, or in some contexts as a strong affirmation meaning 'definitely' or 'without fail'. The word appears to have Proto-Finnic origins and is commonly used in everyday Estonian speech.
